result.execSummary:
The defendant Katheryn M Schwersinske was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: *Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.  *Participation in psychological evaulation and comply with any recommended treatment. *Participation and completion of any other counseling deemed appropriate by the Compas assessment and agent. *No contact with Kelly Jo Faretta (Hauge), her residence or her family. *No contact with Marilyn Schultz or her residence. *Reimburse Marquette County Sheriff's Department for extradition costs in the amount of $487.00. *Granted 137 days credit if probation is revoked. *Bond on file to be applied to all costs/fees by clerk and the balance is to be returned to the poster.

timeConds.notes:
*Sentence to commence forthwith.  *May be served in Columbia County.
**9/19/16: Amended to allow defendant to serve in either Waushara or Adams County if approved by those agencies.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Request to serve jail in Columbia County - Approved BNB/8-1-16
Information given to Court by Atty Gumz during sentencing hearing
to Court from Atty Gumz

Defendant Katheryn M Schwersinske in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Counsel have received the PSI and have now had a chance to review it.  Atty Gumz objects to M. Schultz making a statement today.  BY THE COURT:  Court will allow her to make a statement.  M. Schultz makes statement to the Court.
Atty Hendee makes sentencing arguments.  Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments.  Defendant makes statement to the Court.
BY THE COURT:  Sentence withheld, defendant placed on probation for a period of 3 years with the following conditions:
*Serve 9 months in the Marquette County Jail with huber.  Sentence to commence forthwith.
*Pay court costs of $112.00.
*Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $250.00.
*Participation in psychological evaulation and comply with any recommended treatment.
*Participation and completion of any other counseling deemed appropriate by the Compas assessment and agent.
*No contact with Kelly Jo Faretta (Hauge), her residence or her family.
*No contact with Marilyn Schultz or her residence.
*Reimburse Marquette County Sheriff's Department for extradition costs in the amount of $487.00.
*Granted 137 days credit if probation is revoked.
*Bond on file to be applied to all costs by clerk and the balance to be returned to the poster.

Atty Gumz requests the Court reconsider the order to commence forthwith.
BY THE COURT:  That request is denied.
Court advises defendant of postconviction rights.
Sentencing hearing on July 28, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Katheryn M Schwersinske in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that all parties have received a copy of the PSI that was filed July 14th; in speaking with Atty Gumz the defense is not prepared to proceed because he has not been able to go through the PSI with his client.  Atty Hendee is objecting to the reset as the victim is in court today; he asks that if the court agrees that this be heard sometime today.
Atty Gumz states that he needs time to go over the PSI and asks that this be set next week.
Atty Hendee states that the victim would like it done today and states arguments.  Atty Gumz states that if the victim would like to be heard, he agrees with proceeding to that portion.

BY THE COURT:  Court will reset the matter.  Court will permit the victim to make a statement today if she would like to.  

Recess to give time for the victim to make a decision.

Back on the Record:
Atty Hendee states that the victim would like to speak today.
Victim makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Reset Sentencing.
bond continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 28, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on July 20, 2016 at 11:15 am.

Defendant Katheryn M Schwersinske in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CF31, 08CF112A & 08CF112B tracking together:
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 1 in 15CF31.  08CF112A to be dismissed and read-in.  08CF112B to be dismissed.  Atty Hendee states that the parties would be asking for a PSI and a sentencing date.  Atty Hendee also states that the State agrees to not argue for a Prison sentence.  Atty Gumz agrees.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 1 in 15CF31.  
08CF112A to be dismissed and read-in.  08CF112B to be dismissed
PSI ordered
Set for Sentencing
bond continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 20, 2016 at 11:15 am.
Plea hearing on May 19, 2016 at 09:00 am.
defense request for bond modification

Final pre-trial at 04-01-2016 08:30 am.

Defendant Katheryn M Schwersinske in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
08CF112A & B tracking:

BY THE COURT:  08CF112A - Court needs 3 day Jury Trial, May 25th, 26th & 27th.
Other cases will also be set for these dates.
bond continued.
  Jury trial scheduled for May 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Katheryn M Schwersinske
Current: N1440  5TH RD, Endeavor, WI 53930 United States  (Effective: 07-23-2015)
Prior: N5294 Cty B, Montello, WI 53949 United States
Return date at 09-17-2015 02:30 pm

Defendant Katheryn M Schwersinske in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that Mr. Eggleston appears in court today for a bond review.  
Mr. Eggleston makes a statement to the court and asks to be relieved of his cash bond obligations.  Atty Gumz states that his client does have a job locally and has posted $500 cash on behalf of herself.  
Atty Hendee does not object to Mr. Eggleston getting his cash bond returned; however, the State will leave it up to the court as to how the bond conditions will be done.

BY THE COURT:  Cash bond will be refunded to Mr. Eggleston and his name to be removed as a co-signer.
Court will order a $1,500 cash bond on the matter; the defendant has already posted $500 for herself to the COC office.
Defendant may remain out of custody on the $500 cash that is posted; however in 30 days the bond will be changed to $1,500 cash.  Court gives the defendant 30 days to come up with the $1,000 cash.

08CF112 A and B:  The present bond is a $100,000 Signature bond with conditions of No contact with the victim or Marilyn Schultz.
Atty Hendee states that he has made previous arguments on this bond and will leave it up to the court.
Atty Gumz responds and states that the defendant is working and will remain in the area.  
BY THE COURT:  Bond in 15CF31 to cover 08CF112A&B.
 
  Defendant received a copy of the information & waives it's reading.    Defendant stands mute.  Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  Return date scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Bail/bond hearing at 07-23-2015 02:30 pm

with conditions:
Defendant is not to travel outside Marquette County without allowance from the Court except the defendant may travel to Columbia County only, without court's approval.
Defendant is to reside with Darrin Eggleston at N5294 Cty Rd. B, Montello.
6/29/15:  Bond amended to allow for travel to Sauk County.
STIPULATION AND ORDER TO MODIFY BOND CONDITION TO ALLOW TRAVEL TO SAUK COUNTY
Motion hearing at 06-29-2015 10:00 am
Arraignment at 07-23-2015 02:30 pm

Defendant Katheryn M Schwersinske in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz states his client would like to waive her right to a preliminary hearing.  Court questions defendant.  Court finds waiver of preliminary hearing made freely, voluntarily and intelligently.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.
State files Information.  Atty Gumz received the Information and waives it's reading.  Arraignment scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

with conditions:

Defendant Katheryn M Schwersinske in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Katheryn M Schwersinske in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Atty Gumz asks for a Prelim to be set.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Return.

Atty Hendee gives the court a background of the case and requests a $20,000 cash bond with conditions.
Atty Gumz gives information on Darrin Eggleston who the defendant will be living with.
Atty Gumz asks for a cash bail of $150 to be set and Mr. Eggleston is willing to sign.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 cash bond with conditions:
Defendant is not to travel outside Marquette County without allowance from the Court except the defendant may travel to Columbia County only without court's approval.
Defendant is to reside with Darrin Eggleston at N5294 Cty Rd. B, Montello.

Atty Gumz waives time limits for the Prelim.
BY THE COURT:  Time limits waived; set Prelim.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 09:30 am.
